repository.name: your-memory
repository.description: Open-sourced and improved memory for developers and consumers built on top of mem0.

readme:
Your Memory

A secure, private memory layer for your AI.

Website ¬∑ Dashboard ¬∑ Docs ¬∑ Report an Issue

## What is Jean Memory? Jean securely stores the personal context that makes your AI truly yours. From your unique insights to your personal preferences, this is the data that powers a smarter, more helpful AI. You control what's remembered and what's shared, always. - **üîí Private & Secure**: Your context is yours alone. - **üöÄ Fast & Universal**: Works across all your MCP-compatible AI tools like Claude and Cursor. - **üè† Cloud or Local**: Use our managed service or host it yourself. üß† **Human-like Agentic Memory**: Jean is more than just a vector database. It creates a dynamic, connected graph of your memories, allowing AI agents to understand relationships, context, and how ideas evolve over time. This enables more sophisticated reasoning and a deeper understanding of you.

## üöÄ Quick Start Get started in seconds with our hosted service: 1. **Sign up** at [jeanmemory.com](https://jeanmemory.com) and go to your dashboard. 2. **Choose an app** (like Claude or Cursor) and get your install command. 3. **Run the command** to connect your AI tool. 4. **Restart your AI app** and start using your memory! ## üé• **Video Tutorial** Watch this 5-minute step-by-step tutorial to get Jean Memory working with your AI tools:

**[‚ñ∂Ô∏è Watch the Full Tutorial on YouTube](https://youtu.be/qXe4mEaCN9k)** ## üõ†Ô∏è Local Development Run the entire Jean Memory stack on your local machine. **Prerequisites:** - Node.js 18+ and npm - Docker and Docker Compose - Git **1. Clone the repository:** ```bash git clone https://github.com/jonathan-politzki/your-memory.git cd your-memory ``` **2. Run initial setup:** This creates environment files and starts all services: ```bash make setup ``` **3. Add your API keys:** When prompted during setup, add your API keys: - `OPENAI_API_KEY` (required) - Get from [OpenAI Platform](https://platform.openai.com/api-keys) - `GEMINI_API_KEY` (optional) - Get from [Google AI Studio](https://makersuite.google.com/app/apikey) **4. Build the environment:** After adding API keys, build the environment: ```bash make build ``` **5. Start the services:** You'll need two separate terminals: *Terminal 1 - Start backend (includes Supabase):* ```bash make backend ``` *Terminal 2 - Start frontend:* ```bash make ui-local ``` **3. Access the application:** - **UI**: `http://localhost:3000` - **API Docs**: `http://localhost:8765/docs` - **Supabase Studio**: `http://localhost:54323` ## ‚≠ê Upgrade to Jean Memory Pro Advanced features for power users and developers, including **priority support, advanced search, higher limits, and data export.**

## ü§ù Contributing We welcome contributions! Please see our [contributing guide](CONTRIBUTING.md) to get started. ## üìÑ License This project incorporates code from [mem0ai/mem0](https://github.com/mem0ai/mem0) under the Apache 2.0 License. Jean Memory additions and modifications are proprietary. ## üôã‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è Support - **Docs**: [jeanmemory.com/api-docs](https://jeanmemory.com/api-docs) - **Issues**: [GitHub Issues](https://github.com/jonathan-politzki/your-memory/issues) - **Email**: [jonathan@jeantechnologies.com](mailto:jonathan@jeantechnologies.com) ---
